title: Jacob Marries Leah and Rachel
summary: Genesis 29 describes Jacob’s arrival in Haran and his meeting with Rachel. He agrees to work seven years to marry her, but is deceived into marrying Leah first. He then marries Rachel and begins having children through both wives and their servants.

faq.question: Why did Laban trick Jacob into marrying Leah?
faq.answer: He claimed it was their custom to marry off the older daughter before the younger.

faq.question: How many years did Jacob work to marry Rachel?
faq.answer: Fourteen years total—seven for Leah (unintentionally) and another seven for Rachel.
